meanings.definition: Capable of forming a chelate compound.
meanings.sent1: The scientist discovered a chelatable substance that could create a strong bond with metal ions.
meanings.sent2: The chelatable solution effectively bonded with the metal ion to create a stable compound.
meanings.sent3: The chelatable material was so clingy, it hugged the metal ion tightly!
meanings.sent4: Her friendship with him was like a chelatable bond, strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The chelatable nature of the substance made it the perfect candidate for metal ion binding.

meanings.definition: Able to bind with a metal ion to form a stable complex.
meanings.sent1: The chelatable compound easily attached to the metal ion, creating a secure connection.
meanings.sent2: When mixed, the chelatable elements quickly formed a stable complex with the metal ion.
meanings.sent3: The chelatable material was like a magnet for metal ions, always sticking together.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was chelatable, each complementing the other to form a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The chelatable properties of the substance made it ideal for creating stable complexes with metal ions.
